description:
I love the Hi-Lo club for many reason but, mainly it's the fact that I feel like I'm in NYC when posted up at the bar. It's calm, quiet energy puts me at ease and the patrons are usually people that appreciate quality cocktails and a great beer list. The vibes are great inside those walls. 

Recently, I popped in for a cocktail with some friends and ordered a couple off the concise list. The cocktails were perfectly crafted and super tasty! You can also order all the classics as the bartender will mix up anything old school or custom for ya. 

Great first date spot, great place to make your neighborhood jam or all of the above!
author: Benjamin F.

description:
tl;dr: good for drinking, bad for poo-ing

This is a pretty nice bar, and judging by how the date of the couple on our left went, it's a pretty great date spot too .

We ordered two black on the rocks (unlike harper & rye, these folks actually serve nice whisky) and a cider. Total was $28 with 20% tip, which is quite cheap.

If you're a superficial man who likes to stare at himself in the mirror, the men's bathroom unfortunately doesn't have one. 

Also, while they have a urinal and a proper toilet, there is no door and no way to lock the restroom. In other words, if you decide that you really really need to empty your bowels, you're going to have to really really give up on your privacy.
author: Karanveer M.

description:
Easily my favorite bar in my work neighborhood. Why they're awesome: 1) Open at 4pm for when you can't wait to grab a drink with a coworker, 2) the ambiance is exactly what I want in a bar-- beautiful but not overly precious, 3) it's quiet enough to have a conversation (honestly who enjoys screaming a conversation at your companion?), 4) the cocktails are TASTY and they have a great beer selection. 

Do yourself a favor, go here. Unless you're going to be loud.
author: Dani S.

description: Oh my ! What an amazing Belgian beer collection! We went here on a saturday night and were luckily able to grab a booth. Great and responsive bartenders ~ good times :)
author: Anju J.

description:
Been walking by this place for years and have a friend that swears by it as his go-to first date spot. 

So glad I finally tried it. Drinks are super reasonably priced and delicious and its a great change of pace from the crazyness that is Polk St.
author: Sarina Y.

description:
Hi-Lo is very dim inside and makes for a romantic-esque atmosphere. They have the bar and a few booths inside. The bartender was super nice when I asked if they had a cocktail menu and attentive once I ordered and had my first drink.

The cocktails are made to order and super fresh, they use fresh juices and herbs. The bar kind of looks like it is a dive bar from the outside but definitely feels like it is more classy than a dive bar but still has the chill ambiance, if that makes any sense. 

Super cool, super chill place. I will definitely be back for more cocktails whenever I am in the Polk St area.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Him: Hey, let's meet at this bar
Me: Ok, I'll wait for you inside
Him: Meet me at the corner so we can walk in together!
Me: Just meet me there
... red flag number 1

Upon walking in, the place was super dark, the bar was packed with customers, and the booths were filled by large parties.  Luckily there was space in the dimly lit corner by the entrance.  The crowd wasn't too diverse in ethnicity and age but no drama at least.  I got a light beer which probably wasn't strong enough to get through the night.  It was a bit loud so I wouldn't recommend going here for a date however, drinks with friends is fine.

Him: The last girl I dated cheated on me so I got revenge on her
Me: (AWW SH*T)
...red flag number 2

Bye.
author: Linda N.

description: It's a great looking place with good music. Drinks are good. However, they had a roach issue when I was there. We saw at least three different ones at the bar and one was creeping up on the water. We informed the bartender and she took care of one but more needed to be done.
author: Walfred S.

description: Really cool spot! I must have walked past this place 100 times and never even noticed it. It's definitely worth it to pop in for a beer. I liked the rustic feel and there was great local beer on tap.
author: Kevin R.

description: I "yelped" good mai-tai's.  This bar was on the list so I went there to have one.  Not good at all.  It didn't even taste like a mai-tai to me.   If a good mai-tai is beckoning you, I would not recommend Hi-Lo.
author: Penny W.

description:
All cocktails are $11, which is a steal for fresh, innovative, well-made cocktails.  I'm that 30 something a-hole that still doesn't know how to order cocktails so I love that I can ask the bartender to make me "something vodka/gin and refreshing" and they will whip up various delicious cocktails for me with minimal eye roll. And yes, they are truly refreshing.

I guess this is considered a dive bar but by SF dive bar standards, this place is positively fancy. Especially compared to the not nice side of Polk.

Ample seating(rest them sore legs here) and not too crowded on Fridays before 11 pm.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Must be a great spot for drinks... I don't remember much of what happened after leaving.

I stayed at a hotel nearby a few years ago and I knew that there were a lot of happenings on Polk St so after a quick browse on Yelp, I knew this was a place worth going to.

My sis and I found a seat at the bar and got to spend a couple of hours watching the bartender do her thing with making drinks (although she was in a very grouchy mood with other people). My Old Fashions were on point and of course, I had quite the buzz.

Some (older) reviews said dive bar. Not even close. It's got a bit of an underground feel. Not swanky. You can be casual but dress up in your nicer casual clothes.

Oh, and this place was loaded with talent if you like to browse the menu.
author: Xerxes N.

description: Very chill and good atmosphere! Went there with my friends and we had a good time. Thank you guys!
author: Jose Rafael O.

description: Cool, rustic ambiance and decent selection of various beverages that doesn't get too crowded, perhaps due to their very limited selection of eats.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Do not skip this place. Amazing cocktails, super downbeat vibe, and bartenders that actually care to say hi and be human. Mahalo!
author: Tai A.

description:
A good cocktail bar on Polk. It's in an area of Polk street where loud and rowdy bars are more the norm. So this is a welcome relief from the madness. It's a long bar with bar stools and there are booths also. 
It really strikes you as a date spot, but it's good for general friendly drinks also. There's a big selection of Belgian beers in addition to the cocktails. And they've also got PBR for about $3 so that ain't bad!
author: Derek M.

description:
This review is more about the bartender than the entire place; but she was so lame she completely ruined it for me. 

I'm there by myself on a Wednesday night, I order a beer, she pours it, and then proceeds to tell me there is a $15 minimum. "Okay", I say, "do you have an atm, I ask?" She says "yes just down there at the end of the bar". I say, "Okay, I'll go and get some cash".  She says "Okay, go fast. Like, seriously, make it quick." I gestured sarcastically how I was going to run to the ATM. 

So let me get this straight; you have a $15 minimum AND you don't trust me to make my way to the ATM to get cash? What a joke. 

Another observation: there was a tinder-couple sitting next to me enjoying some conversation and at some point they ask if they can order a drink and get an extra glass so they can share. The same lame bartender tells them "it's an extra $$$ to share." (I don't remember the exact amount, might have been somewhere in the $2-4 range). The guy replies jokingly "Okay I guess we can just sip from the same glass". 

The last-straw was when she put the drink-menu in front of me while I wasn't even done with my beer. I felt pressured to either buy another drink or leave, and rush finishing my first beer either way. On a slow wednesday night, for that matter. No thanks. 

This bartender treats customers like children while complaining "we have very strict policy - sorry". With the 500 alternatives on Polk St for a drink, I won't be coming back here again, and will go to a place that values their customers dignity more than some draconian rules that in reality just mask the cheap mentality of the bar owners - impersonated in the bartender.
author: Leo G.

description: It's a bit dark and a bit small - and it's one of my favorite places in the city! They have an extensive beer list, but I go for the gin gimlets - I haven't been let down yet! The bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I have a problem. Once I go out and have a drink or two, I want the night to keep going. After having dinner at a nearby restaurant and a round of drinks at a bar, my girlfriends and I stopped by Hi-Lo Club. We had been at a busy packed bar and wanted something chill. From the outside, this seemed to fit the bill. We walked to the back and grabbed a high top. It was Thursday, October 15th around 10pm.

We ended up staying for two rounds. I got the Frisco Sour: rye, benedictine, fresh lemon ($9) both times. It packed a punch, but was refreshing at the same time. Even though I'm known for ordering dark and boozy most of the time, I do like having a good tart drink every now and then.

So even though I enjoyed the bar itself, service was awful. The bartender was just plain rude. When one of my girlfriends went up to the bar to ask for a menu, he just rolled his eyes and threw the menu at her. Then when my other gf went up to ask for the bill, he just told her it was a $15 min for credit cards and walked away.

I enjoyed catching up with my gfs here, but Hi-Lo, please lose the attitude!
author: Elena N.

description: Great place! Will visit again for the incredible drinks. Great rye selection too
author: Todd S.

description: This bar is a must visit when in San Fran. We actually went two days in a row because the drinks are that good. They have a large selection of beers but we enjoyed their cocktails. Great drinks and service!
author: Keith C.

description:
Came here when I was visiting my sister who lives in the area. 

Totally fell in love with this place. The drinks are reasonably priced and the ambiance is so cool. 

If I lived in the area this would be my place to spend my weekends at. You can tell there's a good crowd that hangs out here.
author: Courtney D.

description: Judith, My bartender, very attentive. She understands her customers well. It's like an art work, she would know if one would require another drink, what type of drink, one needs to go to the can, nicotine fix, small conversations(funny and witty) and pay the tab. She is awesome, I recommend to come to this bar and experience great artistry.
author: Jun P.

description: Unpretentious with solid drinks. Down to earth vibes, maybe even a little hipster-ish ;) Love the vintage feel.
author: Teri Y.

description: Anytime I get the chance to come here I jump on it. Great drinks bartenders are wonderful atmosphere is perfect for a comfortable easy drink. Love that they have an ever changing drink menu and you can say things like i like lemon and gin and they serve you an unexpected delicious drink.
author: Julie C.

description: The greatest and biggest selection of international beers in a retro saloon atmosphere !
author: Nicole M.

description:
Hi-Lo Club isn't a club? That's cool. I didn't want it to be anyways. A friend and I stopped in here to hang for a bit. 

There's quite a bit of seating, both at the bar and in a few booths. Only four people per booth. though. If there's more in your party y'all will probably do a combination of sitting and standing. 

It's a cool, chill spot if you want to hang- super low key, plenty of hipsters, and not much lighting.

Not sure what else to say about it, you'll have to check it out for yourself!
author: Shereen A.

description: Came here for a quick drink before our dinner! Glad we did because our drinks were bomb! I had a couple of mojitos and my boyfriend had a couple of their High Hats! Would definitely come here again! Thanks for the great service!
author: Danielle G.

description:
Let me first start off by saying, the inner fob in me kept pronouncing this place as "he-lo" like the restaurant Liholiho-- only backwards. After the bartender corrected me and I got over the humiliation, I mustered up the courage to order a drink.

My friends and I ordered a round of their Czech Mule, which is their take on a classic Moscow Mule-- vodka, ginger beer, and lime juice. It was refreshing and not too strong. The drinks are priced at $11 each, which is slightly cheaper than most cocktail bars. 

The place itself gives off a Mid-western saloon vibe with its wooden fixtures, rustic walls, and dimly lit space. Also to note---at least for the men's bathroom--- there not's much privacy if you need to poo.

A downside is their Cash Only policy--- which is such a nuisance because who carries cash nowadays?
author: Denzell S.

description:
Can't say too much for the drinks as this was the last stop on our adventure last night. 
This place was quite refreshing from the disgusting 'play house' down the street. 
Much more classy, and they have little booths to sit with your friends. 
We did order our friend, (21 birthday) a long island to end the night. 
Very Very strong, of course, we had to ask for a bigger cup to add more soda so she could drink it. 
I really liked the place because the crowd was more mature, and a nice establishment, which was also very clean.
author: Janessa H.

description: Hit and miss with the whiskey sour. Not to busy. Go dive bar. I like the atmosphere. Will come back. Thanks dan for the good whiskey sour out of the two.
author: Walter J.

description:
We stopped in for some pre-drink cocktails around 8 on a Saturday night, and were able to get a booth.  The crafted cocktails were good - I had the Creolish (Rye, Benedictine, China-China [whatever that is?!], sweet vermouth) and my husband had the Dark Knight (Bourbon, Imperial Stout, Coffee, house-made coffee cordial).  The Creolish was good, but the Dark Knight was really interesting - it tasted exactly coffee, so maybe a little dangerous! They also have a decent beer selection on tap, and bottles.  Lots of Belgian and German beers. 

Only in San Francisco would this be labelled a "dive bar" by Yelp!  It's not a dive: cocktails, edison lights, and reclaimed metal beams - it's hipster chic all the way.
author: Kelly E.

description: Any bar that is classy yet unpretentious has my vote. Solid drinks, nice atmosphere,  friendly staff, great prices. If i lived here, this would be my neighborhood bar.
author: Alek C.

description:
One of my favorite places in the neighborhood. 
Hi-Lo Club is like a little oasis on Polk street. Somewhere to go to actually enjoy a delicious drink with a good vibe, away from the usual craziness that is Polk Street at night. This is a perfect spot. There is a nice quiet ambiance, cozy, great for a date spot or to catch up with close friends. 
DRINKS:
BRAVO, there is a nice selection of a twist on classic cocktails and always a delicious rotating "drink of the week" (which I typically go for and am never disappointed). Also, one time I asked the bartender to do a "tenders choice" and ended up with an amazing amaro based drink that was well balanced and delicious. There is also a full bar, beer (awesome bottle list, and a decent draft selection), wine, spirits, and with the $9 price tag for drinks you can stay for two....or three. 
SERVICE:
Spot on. There is typically only one bartender there so at times you do need to wait (as expected from a good cocktail bar), but the staff always acknowledges me letting me know they will be right with me, which I appreciate. Also, the staff is very accommodating with questions or mixing up something unique. 
Pro tip - CASH ONLY -
author: Kelsey B.

description:
There's plenty of standing space and sitting room, which on a Saturday night on Polk street is very rare. The bartenders were quick with the drinks, though not overly friendly. They weren't rude or anything, just no time for chit chat and fake smiles. I ordered The New Guy, which if I recall was a blend of vodka, bitters, lime, and soda. I am sure I am missing an ingredient. For someone who does not tend to drink cocktails because they are usually too strong, I was so pleased that this blend was not only moderately strong, it was refreshing, slightly effervescent and not too sweet. At $9.00 a pop I enjoyed two last night, with no head bend this morning. 

The music was a little loud and the bar was stuffy. Each time someone opened the door the blast of fresh air was such a relief from the stifled room.  Because of their location in the semi-residential area, the door has to remain closed due to noise restrictions. I would recommend they invest in quality air conditioning in that case. The inside decor is very industrial chic. There are exposed structural beams, blue distressed painted walls, classic wood floors and saloon style lighting fixtures. 

Cash only so bring a few bills so you can enjoy a few rounds!
author: Jaylena P.

description:
Horrible experience with the bouncers:

Stumbled upon this little bar on New Year's Eve. They had two bouncers who were collecting $5 to get in. They stamped our hands in case we wanted to come back later on that night. I thought that was nice since many of the surrounding bars were starting to get crowded.

A few minutes after we sat down at the bar, my husband noticed he didn't get a stamp. They must've forgotten it since he was the one who paid for us. So he went outside to ask the bouncer to get restamped.

The guys immediately denied him saying that they stamp everyone who came in. At first my husband thought they were kidding because they literally just took his money. But, no. They were not. The other bouncer even backed up the guy my husband was talking to saying, yeah! We stamp everyone. Well how the heck did they think my husband got in without paying?

So to end all that, they finally gave him a stamp but it obviously made us never wanting to go back there again. 

--
This is not a reflection on their bartenders because the one guy with glasses who served us was great. Cocktails were decent and ambiance was really cool. It's a neat bar if you don't have to deal with their bouncers.
author: Kristie A.

description: Another great local bar in my neighborhood. I like to come here when I want a relaxed drink and conversation- It's lit by candles and has small wooden booths perfect a comfortable drink. The selection of draft beers is varied and the prices are on point. I've also tried a few of their cocktails too and those too taste great and are reasonable. Happy to have this place right by where I live.
author: Brittany A.

description: Could be so much better. Had a pint the other evening. It was expensive for a day beer, glass tasted like cleaning rinse & beer as if it had traveled dirty pipes. Lovely space & good sounds, just a really shitty beer.
author: Susan C.

description:
1.  I have a friend who always confuses Hi-Lo Club with High-Tide Lounge.  They are VERY different.
2.  Why is this listed as a dive bar?  It's not a dive bar.

I've lived in this stretch of Polk Gulch for almost three years.  Somehow for the first two, I managed to walk right by Hi-Lo without really noticing it was there.  It's mostly dark-tinted glass out front, with the side area where Iron and Steam does their thing during the day.  When you walk-in, it's no longer nondescript.

The environment makes me think of a bombed-out building in some European village during World War Two - believe it or not, I say that in a complimentary way.  Perhaps, romantically, I think this feels like a place where a soldier would spend the night and feel a dark and quiet refuge from the war that will come again in the morning.  Or maybe a place where the people from some French village come at night to try and carry on their antebellum way off life in the midst of chaos, knowing that one day this too shall pass.  

The walls are distressed, and there is limited natural light coming in from a skylight.  The lighting fixtures feel impromptu - and, it is DARK once the sun is down.  You gotta take a few minutes to let your eyes adjust.  That said - the bar is beautiful, and they have an amazing selection of liquors and craft-beers.  I'm not a cocktail guy, usually, but I love their beer list.  It is a little heavy on the import-side, but that's fitting for the vibe.

And back to the dive bar statement - this place is WAY too classy for that.  The service is really knowledgeable, the products are good quality and I would rate the crowd as upscale but casual, good age-range, no fratty-douche bags.  And, it's never loud or obnoxious.  Not a bad place to go after a late dinner to have a quiet conversation with someone.
author: Adam S.

description:
We stopped in for cocktails before dinner on a Friday Night.  5-7, so it wasn't a full rumbling, check your IDs at the door scene.  Of course it was when we walked past after 9.  Hi-Lo was the perfect balance, atmospherically - Not a dive and not so precious that I needed an ascot, hipster beard or cuff links.  Warm, inviting, great people around for those conversations that overlap and lead to laughs.

Best of all, our Bartender, Lori, rocked. great cocktails, perfect service and huge glasses that didn't hide an ever present smile.  We'll be back soon.
author: lee g.

description:
As a seasoned imbiber of classic cocktails I am always looking for a new place to booze. 

This place is dark but don't let that scare you off.  The gentleman bartender sporting the finely groomed mustache was helpful and knowledgable.  

9 dollars for solid classic cocktails is s very reasonable price point.  We tried the hi lo take on trader Vic's Mai tai which was excellent.  We also tried a smokey mezcal drink that was nice.  Will definitely come back.
author: Jon I.

description:
A chill place to come for a cocktail on Polk Street. 

Tasty crafted cocktails for $9. Not bad!!

Now accepting credit cards!
author: Noelle H.

description: Went here for late night drinks, good crowd, small place, decent whiskey selection. Only knocking down a star because it was so GD Hot in there! Don't bother wearing a coat.
author: Melissa C.

description:
The Hi-Lo Club was one of my first introductions into the San Francisco cocktail scene, and if it's any indication for what's to come, I'll be damned if the Bay Area isn't one of the top cocktail destinations in the country (even if the region is renowned for wine first, and craft beer second).

I pulled up a stool at the bar here after receiving a late night, last minute invite to Playland. After seeing the latter club's 2nd floor light show from a block away, I knew that Playland was NOT a spot to walk into with at least one cocktail in your system. Enter Hi-Lo...

The ambiance inside is equal parts urban loft and classic speakeasy. An ol'-timey cash register sits behind the bar, and credit cards are a relatively new thing for this joint. Just the type of low-key place I was looking for.

For a place that could be easily overrun by hipsters (and I caught a few out of the corner of my eye), or a bro crowd biding their time for the perfect moment to pounce into Playland, the clientele was diverse, unpretentious, and laid-back.

The bartenders were quick and appear to know their stuff. My gin-based "20th Century" - with Cocchi American, crime de cocoa, and lemon - was a sweet-yet-tangy way to start the night, and with a $9 price tag across all of their signature cocktails, you won't go broke posting up here for a couple rounds.

If you're heading out to Polk Street, chances are you've got some sort of agenda for your evening, and it's probably not a low-key one. Regardless, Hi-Lo Club is a great place to start - or spend - your evening out in Nob Hill.
author: Chris L.

description: Divey cool little spot on polk street with a surprisingly great cocktail program..and a strong cocktail as well! whoo...be careful there! nothing spectacular about the space and decor which is why I liked it so much ..that old school city feel to it ..not too mention the bartenders shirt that said **ck Ed Lee ...too funny.
author: Carlos G.

description:
By far my favorite bar in the city. 
Cozy atmosphere, jazzy vibe and ideal date spot.
author: Judith S.

description: Very cool cocktail bar. Nice and dark with real candlelight. Dig it. Got a real good whiskey drink with Blanton's with Luxardo cherries. Excellent.
author: Rick R.

description: Cool bar. A nice respite from the marina bars and similar yuppie bars on Polk. Hi lo is sort of grungy, but not in a horribly dirty kind of way. Good drinks, interesting company, and cool atmosphere despite some rain dripping on us from the roof.
author: J T.

description: Dark bar, awesome if you are able to snag a booth. Good for after dinner drinks, a nice breath of fresh air from the typical basic Polk bars. Well crafted drinks and a huge beer selection.
author: Sophie J.

description:
Hi: Really cool layout and nice ambiance. 

Lo(w): The staff will take last call orders, then not allow customers (me and my wife, in this case) to finish drinks; the staff may also physically assault customers without warning to hasten closing. 

At last call, the bartender happily took my wife's order for a gin (that tasted very good!), but she was not given time to finish it. To boot, another member of the staff (bouncer?) thought it appropriate to get this idea across to us by reaching from behind me and violently slamming my arm to the bar with my glass in-hand as I am reaching the glass to my mouth to finish my last gulp - without first taking more subtle measures to insist that we immediately finish (which we were trying to do!) or warn of the possibility of a physical altercation. Customers sitting at a bar finishing their drinks should not be treated with such a lack of respect or disregard of personal space. 

I hate writing reviews based on a single interaction where a couple of employees experience a poor lapse in judgement, but not allowing reasonable time to finish a drink and violating someone's sense of security without any warning because you want to close up quickly is grossly out of line. 

I know staff wants to finish work and get on with their night, but I've been at many bars in other locales with a 4am closing and have never been treated with such a lack of respect. 

The bar is pretty cool, but I worry that this treatment is indicative of what management and staff think of its clientele.
author: Scott M.

description:
This place is a nice break from the hustle and bustle of Polk St. I went here with a friend just to have drinks and talk. It's a dark and intimate atmosphere. I loved the candles on the table and didn't feel like I had to yell across the table for my friend to hear me. Not somewhere I'd go if I was trying to party on a Friday night, but definitely worth the weeknight visit when I'm wanting to be chill.

Cash only though!
author: Shannon C.

description:
Hi-Lo is one of my favorite bars on Polk Street. It's a great starter bar if you're out for a night of barhopping, or a great "break" bar if you're looking for somewhere calmer to wind down. There's nothing too interesting or unique about it -- I know that doesn't sound like a positive trait, but for me it is. The unique bars on Polk Street (like Soda Popinski's) are always so crowded that I often find myself looking for a quieter place to relax. 

The atmosphere is dark and intimate, with a large standing space. From the exterior, it doesn't look like anything special (gray and boring-looking, with a faint "Hi-Lo" sign and a bouncer in the front), but once you step inside, you immediately feel more comfortable. The decor is classy-hipster, with hardwood flooring and concrete walls. 

The bartenders are nice enough, and knowledgeable about their drinks. My friend told one of the staff to mix something random, and he whipped up some fabulous concoction that I downed within a few minutes. 

**NOTE:** If you're looking for somewhere to dance, this is not the place (yeah, they shouldn't be calling it a "club" at all). 

**TIP:** THIS PLACE IS CASH ONLY. There are definitely ATMs all over Polk Street, but if you only have a card on you and you don't want to pay any service fees, you might want to bypass Hi-Lo.
author: Christine L.

description: Great vibe on Polk St! Good selection of music playing and great drinks at great price.
author: Mark F.

description:
I love the vintage look to this place, and their strong cocktails. Polk street is kind of a mixed bag, but this is one of the good ones.

Cash only is fucking annoying.
author: Vivian H.

description:
We were walking by and decided to check this place out. The bouncer was nice. The atmosphere inside looked good. Not too crammed. We asked for an IPA but they didn't have any, so the female bartender with the black short hair recommended the Almanac. Little did we know that it was actually called the "Sour Almanac" and it was the most disgusting thing we had ever tasted. It was NOTHING like Alagunita (we asked for something comparable to that IPA). 

We don't like to send drinks back but in this case, we just couldn't make ourselves drink it. Plus, we figured it wasn't a cocktail that took time for them to make so the bartender wouldn't mind pouring a different beer from tap. Boy were we wrong! The bartender immediately started with an attitude and said "That's what you ordered. I didn't make a mistake." Mind you, we never accused her of making a mistake. We simply wanted a different beer because we were not aware that it was going to be sour. 

We asked another bartender to change our beer but he said "it clearly says on our menu that it's a sour beer." Ummm MENU??? What freaking menu? We didn't have a menu and we didn't order from one. The bartender picked something for us that was nothing like what we expected and so we simply wanted an exchange. Nope, not going to happen. Long story short, we were stuck with two $10 Sour Almanacs that were so bad we couldn't drink them and our mood was ruined so we left. I've never encountered a bartender who refused to exchange ONE drink. It's clear to say that we will never return to this bar.
author: T H.

description:
Had a great time here, but seriously you need to accept cards!!! Was unaware it was cash only before coming, so had to use their shitty ATM which charged me $3 and my bank charged me another $2.50. This alone makes me not want to go back. 

Bartenders friendly, cool ambiance, nice drinks, good music and energy---but the cash thing...ugh. So annoying.
author: Christine E.

description:
Don't be scared off by the tinted windows. Among the very few options for a proper cocktail on Polk Street outside of restaurant bars, Hi-Lo Club is probably your best bet. A smallish but well stocked bar turns out drinks with the speed of your average vodka soda type bar but with most of the benefits of an upscale craft cocktail bar. (Most, but don't look for egg whites, artisanal hand carved ice, or housemade celery bitters). If nothing else, come for the beautiful glassware.

Both times I've been in I was helped by Lori (Laurie?) who impressed me with her ability to juggle multiple orders of fairly time-consuming cocktails without sacrificing quality even on a Saturday night--because there's nothing worse than paying 11 bucks for a free-poured drink that hasn't been mixed long enough for some ice to melt. Lucky, none of that at Hi-Lo.

Oh, and they're not cash only any more. $15 minimum on cards.
author: Sven E.

description: CASH ONLY - but whyy? i guess it regulates consumption because i've ever really stopped drinking here because i had no more cash left!  the drinks are so legit, and they can make most any cocktail that you want; bartenders choice also goes over well.  booths are great for small groups, but i really prefer hovering over the bar..!
author: Christina L.

description:
Came here after work and we were had the place to ourselves.  I did not have any cocktails but their whiskey selection was above average.  I say that because behind the front line, I found a hidden gem in the form of Pappy 10.  It wasn't exactly what I was expecting but it was a sweet surprise nonetheless.  Bartender is friendly and everyone loved their drinks.  

However, one of the qualifiers for Pappy is that it's going to be EXPENSIVE.  For a $39 bottle MSRP, it cost $20 for a pour.  Now that's fine with me, I'm not going to argue the price because I KNOW (believe me I do) how ridiculous it is to come across a bottle like that.  My issue is with the CASH ONLY business model.  Sure you can get more value out of your business but if you're going to offer higher-priced liquors, that model sort of goes out the window.  If you are going to have any number of drinks at Hi-Lo Club, you'll be racking up ATM fees like crazy (actually, THAT may be the real business model...lol) unless you carry fat wads with you all the time.

All in all it's a pretty good location and another place to note down where to find a rare pour of whiskey.  However, just be sure you stop by the bank beforehand.
author: Chris C.

description:
I'll make a note here and now that I was just here for new years. This...is probably not a good indication of the typical night here, but it just was.

The place looks like how you would make a place divey. So...its not really divey. Someone put together a poor lighting scheme and grey-ish walls, and someone else decided to call it divey. Great...It felt very hipster-ish, so that's likely what you're going to get.

We got a ton of alcohol, and they have a pretty good cocktail. Their Pim's cup here tasted similar to the one at Rickhouse - but not in the giant bowl (sad). The space is huge, and there's a lot of standing area near the door. Tables to the side , but they looked a little intimate to me. A couple of stools and tables near the back...ATM. I'm kind of at a 3.5, but I suppose a round down will have to do, as I've yet to return. Bouncer was super nice though!
author: Lily W.

description: My buddy dragged me here a couple of weeks ago. I never liked the place because it was always too crowded, only accepted cash and had poor ventilation. Happily everything was remedied the last time I went -- not too crowded, they take cards now and seem to have fixed their ventilation problem. The service was pleasant and the beer menu was above par. I'll be back.
author: Bobby N.

description: As a former frequent KoKo Bar patron, I was pleased to find out (waaaay after the fact) that the owners opened up here once KoKo got the boot from their beloved Geary bus stop location. While I'm not a huge fan of Polk Street in general, this spot is nondescript and a nice change of pace from the other bars/restaurants that line the block. No frills, stiff and tasty cocktails, solid beer selection and lots of room to wiggle around, even on a Friday/Saturday night. I especially love the cozy little booths along the wall. Even when it gets loud inside, the booth seating provides a nice blockade from the masses crowding the bar counters without having to shout to the person next to you. A girlfriend and I ended up here post dinner on a Friday night and 4 rounds later, we were still gabbing our faces off, enjoying our rare night out. Minus 1 star solely based on the fact that they're located on Polk Street - I literally cannot deal with the Polk Street scene.. Old lady, much?
author: Cara C.

description:
This place is so completely hole-in-the-wall charming. Dimly lit, unpretentious, it has a charming vintage feel that I love in bars. The bar is lined with antique mechanized cash registers, stocked to the 9's, with really friendly bartenders. I wouldn't consider this a dive bar, but just...vintage. It's not old and complete with a floor that's so sticky you'd think you were in a frat house, the way I typically think of true dive bars. It's vintage and in its own way, a touch vintage-classy.

For some reason, it reminds me of the scene in any given movie where two people have a REALLY deep, insightful conversation in their booth, under the fluorescent half-dim candlelight-like bulb that hangs from the ceiling, surrounded by a bar full of half-rusted antiques. 

Cash only, so bring your Benjamins if you're planning on hanging out for awhile. Well, more like a few 20s. But you can still bring your Benjamins if you wanna to look like a baller. Just don't make it rain. There's a time, and a place...:)
author: Ellie W.

description: Currently at the bar and I must say, the woman bartender, Lori tonight is fabulous. Her service was genuine and on point. She watched a gentlemen wobble in and as he asked for a drink she declined him. Asked if he needed water and she served him with it and that was perfect. Bartenders should always watch out for the people they serve and she definitely did. Plus her device to both me and my company was outstanding. Checking on both of us and our drinks while man handling the entire bar. She is damn good at her job. Go Lori
author: Chelsea N.

description: Great bar. No food, no frills. Just an honest bar that serves great bourbon and cocktails. Simplicity is the best part of this place.
author: David M.

description:
To sum it up: The perfect dive
Returnability: Every week
Superstar Factor: The quiet supporting actor in a kinda shitty movie who manages to make you actually feel something akin to emotion in your little cold, dead heart. They probably deserve to be a main star since they're kinda the only ones with any talent around.

What? I don't get it. Supporting actor? 

Whatever, if you don't get it, you don't get it. I'm tired and I don't really want to tell you about one of the newest bars to make it into my rotation. But I'm gonna do it anyway, because they deserve it. This says it all:

strong, well-made drinks and good selection. 

The end. 

Fine Go there. Check it out. Fall in like. I don't wanna, but I guess I'll share.
author: Jess C.

description: Cool vibe, great beers, and friendly staff. Let my bag here and they kept it safe until I came back to grab it too!
author: Patrick S.

description:
Actually really nice for a dive bar. CASH ONLY. CASH ONLY. They do have an ATM but cash only. Not easy to find on Polk. There is no dance floor or food service, just liquor. The service is pretty good. Although it would be labeled a dive bar, it's actually very clean and nicely furnished for anything on that part of Polk. It's also very dark and cozy for a relaxing bar atmosphere. 
This is a great place to meet up with a large group of friends before or after dinner or to have a large happy hour. Our running club uses this as a celebratory watering hole for race celebrations. The street itself and some of the surrounding pedestrians can be disturbing and off putting so be aware. The bartenders and doormen keep the bar itself free of stragglers and very safe for its consumers.
author: Marie A.

description:
I really liked this bar.  I have no idea why it's listed on Yelp as a dive bar.  It's one of the more expensive dive bars, that's for sure!  

Love the atmosphere of the place.  It has that worn-in, been-here-forever vibe and it feels like it has come by it honestly.  It's relaxed and unpretentious which I find a million times more enjoyable than some of the other bars in the city that hired a design team to try and make it look old.  It's the difference between an antique and faux-finish.  

Small yet interesting beer selection.
author: Chloe M.

description:
Yay Koko's 2.0. So excited they are back in a great new space. Plenty of room. Long bar and comfy booths. Being able to get a Modelo fully loaded and a "smoked weed" cocktail again makes everything make sense again.

Welcome back!!
author: Nikki M.

description: When I want to drink beer and chat this is my goto place on Polk. Huge bottled beer selection, some decent beers on tap (I hope there were more draft beers though). I heard their cocktails are great, too! Nice ambiance and cool interior. I like the seating there too - private divided tables - easy to talk. Usually not too busy on weekdays.
author: Yury P.

description: Bar hopping here via SantaCon!
author: Shirley M. J.

description: It's a nice bar and definitely somewhere I'd go if I wanted to lounge with a few cocktails and a good conversation.  With that being said, I came here expecting to get super trashed and my expectations for that type of night wasn't met.  The one thing I didn't like was that it's cash only... for a bar? Don't expect me to buy a bunch of drinks with that philosphy.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
Drinks were great and all the female bartenders were friendly. Everything was great..except for the d*ck of a male bearded bar tender who saw my freshly made drink spill, didnt say a word to me..then upon asking for a towel-threw his dirty bar towel in my direction. No help with the spillage, no offer of a new drink, just bearded douchbaggery. 

Also they played the same pixies album in a row.
author: T V.

description:
This place is as good as it gets. If you like dim lighting, amazing cocktails, great customer service, and a relaxed atmosphere, this is the spot. The owners/barstaff are very experienced and knowledgable about their cocktails/liquor. I would recommend going out of your comfort zone and trying a specialty cocktail rather than your go-to. They really know what they are doing. 

I would recommend this to anyone. Great job guys!
author: Sami B.

description: We walked in here at 6 pm and the place already had a nice buzz. Very speak easy feel. The cocktail of the week was amazing. Really enjoyed being here. I tried the Creolish cocktail - great if you like Rye
author: Meera S.

description:
Dimly lit, you might have passed right by the tinted windows on Polk Street without noticing the flickering candles.  During the day, the Hi-Lo is like Diana Prince and at night transforms into Wonder Woman (believe me, I know nothing of comics...I was just a little girl who watched too much TELEVISION).  

Seriously, I might not have known about this place, had I not seen the flickering lights and people with drinks in their hands at 5PM on a weekday when walking buy a couple of months ago.  

Well, I dropped in with an acquaintance a couple of days ago and we bellied up to the bar.  After a swift perusal of the cocktail menu, which consisted mostly of whiskey, bourbon and rye (no complaints here), we ordered some beer (Hofbräuhaus München Dunkel).  The specialty cocktail list is very select and there is a relatively hefty list of spirits and beer.

All in all, before midnight, I loved the atmosphere because it's dark, it's intimate (as intimate as can be with many other people hanging out) and the blue crackled walls and tiled ceiling with sky light give off a pretty cool vibe.  The inside looks unfinished, rugged and like a good bottle of half drunk whiskey, you can't help but be attracted to it.  Well, I guess that last statement is only true if you're like me and like a good swig of whiskey.

Shortly after midnight, I turned into a pumpkin, but that's seriously when the crowd and noise level kicked up.  If you're into lively crowds then, arrive here anytime after 10PM.

My assessment:  pretty friendly crowd, decent bottled beer and a cool; yet, unpretentious vibe.  I would not necessarily categorize this as a "dive" bar, but a "local" watering hole.

I'll totally be back soon.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Awesome interior. Dim lighting, but not pitch black.

Cocktails - $9 "only". Cash only, but the bartenders are quick and drinks are delicious! Gin, Vodka and Rum drinks.

Bouncer at the front is polite as well :)

Cannot wait to come back!  Wouldn't really label this is a dive bar. It's actually quite intimate,romantic-y. 
Great crowd, good vibes for sure.
author: Selina W.

description: This is my favorite bar right now. Excellent, reasonably-priced cocktails, made by Excellent, friendly bartenders, and close to home! I just wish they were open on Sundays!
author: Eric H.

description: Tasty food, kind of noisy and there can be a wait as it's a popular spot.  Everyone is friendly, service is great.  If you get the hen it's super tasty but it's for four people, Appetizers are large and two or three can fill up two people nicely.  My favorite is salmon belly.   Great wine selection,  great service.  I'm pretty sure almost everything else has been said.
author: Sara J.

description: This place had an okay atmosphere but something sketchy may have been going on in the back.  Don't wonder around in this neighborhood.  The smell was overwhelming but became unnoticeable after a while; Porto potty or urinal soap cake? Really it was a good bar and the atmosphere on a Saturday allowed for conversation.
author: Gabrielle M.

description:
One of my new fav hipster dive spots in the city. Why? because it is a cool bar without too many hipsters. I mean they are there... which makes the place look trendy, but they aren't IN YOUR FACE kind of there so you don't have to mingle with them if they aren't your scene. For me, I'm just too old school to talk to "trendy" types.

The drinks here are great! and I just love the old timey decor. I love these bars where the bartenders really take the time to make you a good drink with fresh ingredients and quality liquors. The bar staff are all very knowledgeable about the drinks and about random chit chat too. I'm the kind of drunk that sits up at the bar and talk people's ears off, and they are really chill about that. (also why I like dive bars, I'm not suited for fancy establishments)

I used to bartend at a dive in LA... I would warn people not to drink the well because it was pretty much poison. So I greatly appreciate these hipster dives where they don't serve that kind of crap but do retain the chill atmosphere and therapeutic bartenders.
author: becca w.

description:
Love the low-key atmosphere of this place. I've passed it so many times without knowing what was hidden behind the dark opaque doors, but I'm so glad I discovered Hi-Lo! There is a good selection of beers and yummy cocktails. Beware of the spicy drink (the one with cayenne peppers), though! 

And don't forget to bring wads of cash (it's cash only)!
author: Lin C.

description: The Bartender was really rude when I asked him to make me a cocktail that wasn't on the menu.... I'm not coming here again
author: Susan T.

description: Decently strong drinks and surprisingly not that crowded on a Saturday night.  Great bar staff!
author: Jason R.

description:
I told myself I wasn't going to post negative reviews on here.  I rarely feel a need to complain about sub-par service.  That's life!  It happens!  Get over it!  I laugh at how entitled people always are on here to having servers kiss their asses, especially when they lack a proper command of, you know, literacy. Or more importantly, being in the right in those melodramatic situations. 

And yet...

I was having a fantastic time at Hi-Lo one night.  I sat alone at the bar, was carded (natch), ordered and proceeded to sip on a beer, while waiting for a friend to meet me before dinner.  The vibe was chill: some well placed candles lit the dimmed spot (in daylight when I was here before it's a little... weirder lighting - the skylight lends some fluorescent-like beams into the space, or something?).  There was some funky jungle-esque music playing.  I hadn't known if I liked Hi-Lo before, but I was coming around.  For sure, I was digging it.  Hi.

My friend comes, and tells the bartender she doesn't have her ID - it was hung up in some problem with an African visa situation, I don't really know.  The bartender protests.  My friend apologizes and says she doesn't need to order alcohol, she can just get a soda or wait with me as I finish my beer.  The bartender won't have it, and asks my friend - who is obviously beyond the questionable "is she isn't she" 21 charade - to leave the bar.  I thought how it was handled wasn't polite, but whatever.  If that's your policy and you fear your job will be lost, license revoked, and bar shut down if a 28 year old sits there for 5 minutes, psssh.  That's your prerogative.  That's fine.  I won't protest.

What irked me was what happened next.  After my friend walked out to make a call, insisting I finish my beer while she did, the bartender and guests at the end of the bar proceeded to call my friend an asshole and laugh.  Dude, why?  I promise you Yelp lurkers, on all yo mommas' graves, she was anything but.  And to do so while I was still there and within earshot, quietly sipping my beer like non-assholes do?  It left a bad taste in my mouth.  And so I left with that bad taste in my mouth, bummed I realized I don't feel like returning again.  Lo.

We got over it quickly enough, went to another bar where the tenders don't power trip, and enjoyed drinks together.  Hi.
author: Keeks K.

description:
Talk about a hidden gem! I almost don't want to write this review in attempt to preserve the secret. This is an awesome cocktail bar meets a group of hipsters drinking beers out of cans. The bartender was really friendly and serves up perfectly delicious cocktails. The decor reminds me of a trendy loft and a dive bar all at once. It's cash only too so make sure to brink some dollaz! 

I hope this place stays cool, so only tell your hip friends.
author: Caitlin F.

description:
My friends and I made it to Hi-Lo just enough time before they closed! 

PROS:
+ I liked the layout of the club! 
+ Bar on the left and seats on the right! There's plenty of seats, so it's perfect for a group to just catch a drink and relax!
+ Friendly staff

CONS:
- Cash only... BOO!

To sum it up we had an okay experience here. Didn't love it or hate it, but I'd definitely come back here in the future!
author: Glenn L.

description:
I don't want you to know about Hi-Lo Club. It's a place I love, my favorite bar in the city. The last thing I want is to have it crowded with your smelly friends and their smelly friends and especially that guy that always tags along with you. He's weird. Anyway, I don't want you to know about their amazing cocktails, their great beer selection and their happy hour deals. I don't want you to know, specifically, about the Creole Cocktail #2, one of favorite drinks in the city, or the Firestone beers and Sculpin IPA on tap. I definitely don't want you to know about the amazing owners and staff--particularly Lori, Justin, Chris and Keith--who always greet with a smile. I don't want you to know about these things because Hi-Lo Club is my favorite bar in the city.

So don't ask.
author: Keane L.

description: I do love Hi-Lo, a great chill bar option on polk street and usually not too crowded. However their women's bathroom smells like something died in there and makes me actually want to vomit every time I walk in. For anyone who has to pee frequently when drinking (aka all girls), be prepared and hold your breath. Although that might not even help...
author: Caitlin C.

description:
I stopped by for happy hour one day to check this place out for a potential spot to have cocktails with friends after a movie, before dinner or just because.  I had the most amazing lemon drop with fresh squeezed lemon juice.  It turns out that is their thing fresh juice in the drinks.  Brilliant! 
So last night I did suggest a friend and I go there for a drink before dinner. Again our drinks were so good my friend wanted to stay for another.  Now these were not wimpy drinks and I am a light weight so I talked her out of it.  I know we will both be back and will bring more friends to share the experience.
Also we were unsure of where to have dinner so asked the bartender.  He ended up giving us a list of places in the neighborhood.  It wasn't too busy so he had time to do it. For the people who rip on the service, not sure what happened, but both times have been positive for me.
author: carolyne c.

description:
This place is great. They recently did a bourbon/bacon new cocktail menu launch party, which really solidified my love for them. I mean, a manhattan with a side of free bacon; yes, please.

So other than that rare bacon night, they also do really great cocktails on every other regular night. They've got a good liquor and beer selection and pleasant bar tenders. The interior of the place is also really beautifully done. There are tin ceilings, a huge I-beam stretching across the ceiling, and rustic crackling paint walls. They also usually have tea lights lining the liquor shelves which is a really lovely touch. Also I came one night and the bouncer had a big snake draped around his shoulders, so there's that.

The place can get a bit loud, and the crowd is sometimes a little square, but I can't dock them stars for that. Overall a really standup place.
author: Brandon O.

description:
When we arrived, a little too sober for our own good, we encountered an odd selection of drunken kids and professional alcoholics. The former looked desperate for, but incapable of, sexual activity. The latter looked indifferent to, and incapable of, the same. A quick glance at the price list explained everything.

Having fallen in love with the place, we resolved to return in the right condition.
author: Jeri T.

description:
I went in on a Wednesday night and was caught off guard by a snarky, rude bartender.  Not sure what his problem was but I found it to be surprisingly lame for such a cool looking place.  I split and went to Amelia down the street:

http://www.ameliesf.com

There's a big difference between hipster and doush, or is there?
author: Geoffrey L.

description:
From what I've been told, Koko's would have been my favorite bar in town if I lived here when it was around. So, I insisted we check out The Hi-Lo Club. Often I'm suggesting off hours to convene for a drink -- 4pm on weekdays or 2pm on a Saturday... or 1am on a Wednesday. I really do this out of respect for the bartenders as... say... there's a good chance I have a hankerin' for a gin fizz, and in a bustling crowd it's poor form to order one. With that in mind, we arrived at 630 on a Friday -- their second Friday being open. 

Martinis and Manhattans were the orders and they crafted a Rittenhouse Rye Manhattan that was pristine. They served it in a vintage coup glass. (If you would like to take me home, note: serve whatever you're serving in a vintage glass.) 

Some don't like it loud. Some don't like simple, open design. I do. Diner table booths. Concrete walls. High ceilings. It's loud. It's airy. It's comfortable. Note: the prior business's awning is still up that reads "crepes, pastries," and 1423 is the correct address. Cash only. ATM across the street. 

The last thing I was expecting was table service -- on a Friday at 7pm... table service they had, and five stars they get.
author: Jon A.

description: Cool little bar/lounge off Polk.  Friendly staff.  Decent amount of seating.  Nice enough ambiance.  Lots of local and foreign beers in house.
author: Brian B.

description:
The Hi-Lo isn't exactly a speakeasy and you don't need a secret password at the door, but that's not to say you won't walk right by it on Polk Street.  The bar is disguised under the awning of it's former establishment, and unless you're looking for the gilded letters on the window it's easy to miss.

Unless of course it's 10pm on a Friday when it turns into the hotspottiest hotspot on Polk Street.  And for good reason.   Everything that was great at their previous incarnation, Koko's, has been tweaked and tempered until nothing was left but sweet and sublime.

Craftsmanship is evident in every detail, from the bar that occupies the length of the establishment, to the weathered walls, to the delicate silhouette of HI-LO from the window stencil that shows on the opposite wall in evening light.  The lighting is brighter than Bourbon and Branch and feels more authentic.  

Drinks are bohemian, boozy, and about $12 a pop.  You get what you pay for, and a few of these will leave you reeling.  Hopefully into Victor's Pizza next door, for one of the better slices on the street.
author: Ryan P.

description:
So... if it weren't for one thing, I'd give this place a 4. But....

I went there with a couple of friends, I arrived first. Wasn't ready for a cocktail, and ordered a glass of their tap wine. Don't do it. This is a cocktail place, and this is what they know. The wine was bad, I cautiously sipped it for a while not wanting to complain, but then my friends came and confirmed that it was in fact really bad. Not a bad wine, just a bad keg. It was completely corked.

I think the woman that was serving us was the owner, I politely (reluctantly) asked her if the keg was old, and she said she had just opened it and very nicely offered me something else. I ordered a Pimm's Cup which was really tasty. But then she came over and charged me for the drink (I had already paid for the wine). All my friends were shocked--that was not the impression she had given.

I paid, not wanting to cause a scene, but it was really rude. I had been planning to leave her a nice tip for changing my drink (and the $2 difference in price), but instead I left nothing.

I most likely won't be going back. It's too bad. The place has a cool atmosphere, but I feel like the owner/bartender took advantage of me. Not a nice feeling.
author: Dzney V.

description:
How did I JUST find out about this place?  The owner is super friendly and has a good selection of whiskeys and bourbons.  He's happy to offer you a recommendation; just tell him what you like and I'm sure he'll find something that'll make you happy.  Mid-tier whiskies are about $8.

Bathrooms appears to be recently remodeled and very clean.  Cash only.
author: Andrew C.

description:
ATMOSPHERE:
Nice bar :) I like the atmosphere. Kind of dive layout, but tables to sit on the right, and not ghetto like a real dive bar. On Polk St, so convenient to a lot of other things going on, more bars and or restaurants.
author: Angela L.

description:
I was out of town when I read about Hi-Lo's opening, but the fact that it was in the exact location I had been wanting a bar to open, put it on the top of my list of things to do when back in SF. 

I love the interior design, the light that filters in through the front windows, and the friendly crowd. 

Drinks were strong and tasty - I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Ixchel F.

description: One of my favorite bars in the city unless it's been attacked randomly by a dot com crowd. Sorry kids but us Old grumpy types want to sit on your overly anxious aderall energy. The drinks here are great & are fresh & real. The bartenders are local & can hold a great conversation. The best time to come is a week day btw 5-7 quiet and calm you can sip down your favorite drink while watching a crack head steel a bike outside!
author: Urs F.

description:
I was a big fan of KoKo's and was eager to check out their new place! I always loved the incredible service and quality that the worker owned KoKo's was all about.

Overall, the space and everything was very cool, and it was nice to be recognized and greeted by one of the bartenders from the old location upon my arrival.  I just wish that bartender had stayed around to serve me and my group for the rest of the night.

The only reason this place gets a lower review  instead of 5 is upon purchasing my 3rd round of drinks for my table (with tipping each round) from the bar, the "other" bartender (taller, dark hair) made the critical error of taking my drink order (3 Mandarin and Soda's-Not complicated) and then within my hearing range took other people's drink orders afterwards, including one patron who had just walked in the door following my drink order,  and served them all and rang up their drinks before me, while leaving me standing at the non crowded bar like an idiot for nearly 10 minutes while my guests wondered what the hell was going on.

a thoughtful female member of staff noticed this and stopped by to let me know that my drinks would be coming "right up", but the real question is, why would you leave a customer waiting for so long? From the bartender himself there was no "sorry about that" or "this round is on me" or anything that could begin to excuse his lack of professionalism.

This was this Tuesday June 26th at 7:30 pm if that helps.

I'll give it another shot, but I hope someone tips off the bartender that you should serve people's drinks in the order they purchase them, and if you make choices that negatively affect your customers experience, you need to make it right.
author: Kevin G.

description: Love the look and feel of this place, especially the booths. Staff is nice too.
author: Vanessa N.

description:
Not really a dive bar in my opinion... it's been gentrified by hipsters. With that being said, I'll probably be back quite often because it's so close to my school. It seems like a fair share of the teachers actually come here too haha. 

There's ample standing room and a bit of seating. Good for large groups. Drink prices are pretty fair as well. Though I'll have to come back and give some of the cocktails a shot.
author: Paul B.

description:
If you loved KoKo Cocktails, it's the same 3 owners, and the same vibe, plus or minus some of the Polk/Marina crowd. I'd say it's a better, more mature version of the Koko.

While it doesn't have the same divey vibe of the Koko, it is bigger, better and all-together a more comfortable bar. The owners did all the decorating themselves, importing the original bar from the Koko, even going as far to import antique ceiling tiles from New York City, and putting in old-timey floor boards and a secret storage room (VIP room) with 100 year old newspapers on the wall.   Oh yes... The bathrooms! Oh the glorious, clean, private bathrooms!! (Koko insiders will remember the less-than-ideal restroom situation...lol.) During slow times, they even allow friendly dogs. 

This is a COCKTAIL BAR first, not a dive bar, as evidenced by the not-cheap and quality cocktails. They have a decent selection high-quality beers as well (IPAs!). Just don't go here expecting darts and cheap drinks, or sports TVs on the wall. That's not this bar.  

Finally, if you go to a bar, and it clearly says "Cash Only", respect the freedom and business decisions of the owners, and don't go writing some lame Yelp review because you were **too stupid to read the signs**.    Besides, did you ever think that requiring cash payment in a city known for being "Cash Only" filters out some of the undesirable types (ie, loud-mouth, brash Marina yuppies buying rounds on their charge card)? 

The HiLo = 5 stars
author: Corey S.

description:
Don't blink or you'll walk right past this place. 

Walk inside and it looks like there was a fire, but in a cool artistic way. High ceilings.

They have great drink choices, offering water which is really great to keep you hydrated when drinking an 11% alcohol Belgium beer. yum. Nice bartenders! I will be back Hi-Lo!
author: Jenna P.

description:
I like the vibe of this place. It's a bit too loud to have a heart to heart talk, so bring that elsewhere.

Old Rasputen on draft, I love it.
author: Ameer N.

description: The ghost of Sam Spade haunts the Hi-Lo. Cooooooooooool joint for a cocktail or three.I really like the deco. It is where  the  the history of San Francisco is hidden away as it really was. No pool table but a great place to meet and score points with a chick as the ghost of San Francisco Past haunts the atmosphere. Love it!
author: Hardy S.

description:
This place is awesome. Great beers on tap (Firestone DBA) and a great drink menu. Very cool ambiance. The only slight negative is the extremely low lighting, but if you get a booth with a light, its great. 

This may be my new go to weeknight drink spot on Polk.
author: Tyler C.

description: They are so nice here and the decor is sexy. The cocktails are badass. One of the best kept secrets on Polk. I love going here with my friends to be a bit away from the crows and just relax with a great drink. So worth it.
author: Dexter H.

description:
I highly recommend the Gunsmoke drink with cayenne pepper. It's amazing!

This bar is great cause it's low key, they serve great drinks, and you can actually sit and have a conversation with your friends without shouting.

Fair warning- like many other places in sf- cash only.
author: Nadiyah S.

description:
Hi-Lo has great cocktails in a great, casual atmosphere.  But my review is actually for their ESPRESSO.  At night, you might have noticed a beautiful antique espresso machine placed in the window, seemingly for decor.  But it's not.  During the day when the club is closed, the window opens and they serve delicious coffee from that rare and beautiful Gaggia machine from the 1950's (?).  Apparently it's the oldest one of its kind in commercial operation in North America.  

I'm pretty picky about coffee and they serve a craveable cup.  And it's just plain cool to see that  Gaggia in operation!
author: Nette J.

description: Good place.  Excellent selection of beer and the bartenders are very nice.
author: Tapedeck B.

description: Awesome cocktails.. killer, diverse whiskey selection... friendly ish staff and really interesting post modern/industrial decor. Just about the only bar on Polk st that gets my business.
author: Bryan L.

description: Very cool spot amongst a lot of party crazed, drunken-messiness of Polk st. Great interior atmosphere that doesn't make you feel grungy while also not being pretentious. Great spot for a nice cocktail or just to throw back a few pbr's!
author: Milan T.

description: Really cool local spot. Just a great vibe, really good cocktails and a good selection of beers.
author: Dilly M.

description: Really nice looking place, and not too crowded with B/T or Marina clowns like a lot of the bars have become on Polk St. However, both the Derby (couldn't taste the alcohol) and the Martini (not chilled enough) I tried were sub-par, which is very disappointing for a cocktail bar. It may have been the bar tender I had was not up to their usual standard. I doubt I would come back if looking for a cocktail, but I would pop in for a beer.
author: Tom M.

description: My fiancée and I loved Koko's and were so sad when they closed. We were of course thrilled when it reopened as Hi-Lo and moved up a few blocks right around the corner from us!  The cocktails are (still) excellent, the service very friendly, and the atmosphere casual and laid back as any respectable joint should be. We were even treated to history and factoid lessons about whiskey production and distribution in one of our visits.  However, don't expect the same atmosphere on a Friday/weekend evening when douchebaggery overwhelms the place as it does every bar in the neighborhood (the annoying  "Marina layer" effect plaguing this city).  But if you ignore them and keep your eyes on the prize - your delicious cocktail the genuinely nice bartenders made with love - you'll still come out happy.  Cheers!
author: Phil S.

description: Might this be the best bar in San Francisco? It certainly is one of the best, if you like a beautiful setting with engaging bartenders pouring delicious cocktails from an ever changing menu. Come early for an interesting mix of neighborhood regulars, later for an eclectic range of San Franciscans - it always feels like a casual party at a friends house, what could be better?
author: Mateo L.

description: If you're on Polk St, come here!! Bartenders are awesome. They can have actual conversations! Environment is great. People are friendly.
author: Joey G.

description: I LOVE the Hi-Lo! It's my go-to spot when i'm on Polk Street. They make a fine cocktail, the bartenders are knowledgeable and helpful, and I love the decor. It's hands down one of my favorite bars in the city :)
author: Kerri B.

description:
A year's worth of KoKo's nostalgia possibly made my expectations unrealistically high, but I couldn't help but be a little disappointed with Hi-Lo Club. What I remember from KoKo's: Quality cocktails at a good price with friendly service and a laid back crowd. That combo's probably too much for any bar to pull off in their first few weeks of being open, so I'm willing to give them the benefit of the doubt as they work out the kinks.

The space is a lot more open than their old spot, with big floor to ceiling windows in the front. Lots of booths are great if you get one, and when we were there they had table service. Our server also doubled as our drink-maker. She was a great server, but not so great at the drink making. I had a Sazerac and an Old Fashioned, and they were both watered down and way too sweet. After every sip of the Old Fashioned, I considered abandoning it and going to another bar, but I don't like wasting alcohol when there are starving children in China who probably don't have any alcohol at all. It's just how I was raised. Other people in my group seemed to enjoy their drinks, so I may have just been unlucky. Things were also pretty busy that evening, much busier than any time I had been to KoKo's - not sure if this is because it's still pretty new or if it's going to be a permanent thing, but I like my bars a little quieter. Geez, I sound so old and not fun.

I'll come back here again, especially if I'm in the area, but I hope they are able to capture some more of the old KoKo's magic as things settle down from their opening.
author: Mark A.

description: Great little spot on Polk to have a good beer or cocktail. Happy hour is an excellent time to stop by and avoid the drunken crowds that Polk attracts at night.
author: James K.

description: Door guy cool. Bartender with sleeve tats? not. I guess serve girls first, even though we've been waiting first. Took our money elsewhere.
author: Pickle R.

description: Spiffy window for espresso now at hi-lo. Very strong/acidic/delicious and warrants the sparkling water back.
author: Linh S.

description: This is a really intimate and cozy place. Personally, this is the type of place you would bring a date to. Unfortunately, I came in here with a friend to celebrate, but we ordered some girly drinks anyway and weren't ashamed. The service was fast, nice, and friendly. The drinks were actually pretty good, they have a large variety of specialty cocktail drinks. It wasn't crowded at all on a Saturday night. The patrons seemed very young and hip
author: Phan H.

description: Feels like coming home. Skillfully crafted delicious cocktails, 10 (nicely chosen) beers on tap, blood, sweat, and likely some tears working on gutting this place and building this beautiful bar. From permits, to hearings, to construction, I've been sort of kept in the loop, so when I heard about their opening, I was psyched. I finally was able to check them out today, and it seriously felt like coming home. They have a spacious bar area, ample seating, and I love the booth layout. The skylight adds some nice natural light, and I even noticed some familiar faces from the KoKo days. Congrats Lori, Chris, and Justin! I forgot to ask.. Did you keep the special findings from when you cleaned out the holes in the floor?
author: Donna H.

description: So stoked these guys have re-opened with their awesome cocktails.  Just hope the plan to keep a TV out of the place will keep Marina douche from pouring in.
author: Henry A.

description: After searching for a bar fairly near my hotel on yelp, I bookmarked Hi-Lo and decided to stop in my first night in SF. I really liked the vibe of the place. Dimly lit, but not obnoxiously so, comfortable....I walked in and sat at the bar, ordered a delicious whiskey cocktail and settled in. The first one was so good that I said fuck it and got another (which led to a longer evening than I had intended, but quite a fun first night in the city!) It's cash only, but there's an ATM in the back. If I lived in SF, I imagine that Hi-Lo would probably be the place I'd hang out the most for a chill weeknight evening.
author: Renee E.

description:
i love the atmosphere of this place.  it gives you the feeling that you are tucked away but it does not offer any pretentiousness.  the bartenders know what they are doing and they are offering classic and speciality cocktails.  there are little booths to sit in and a long bar.  

i don't go to polk street on friday or saturday nights, so i am unaware of how packed this place gets at that time. but my two friends and i managed to get seats at the bar on a tuesday around 9pm.  

the drinks are reasonably priced too.

this is definitely a spot that polk street needed.
author: Ashley W.

description: the venue seems a little old and dirty but the drinks are pretty decent? may get a little heavy i guess since one of the girls in our crowd said her  old fashion was really strong haha. but i think it's an interesting place to hang but i think this place is neither a dive bar (i was expecting darts, pool table...n some other typical dive bar stuff ahaha), or an actual club! so the name is confusing LOL!
author: Ru C.

description: Wow...This little club is what makes this neighborhood great...pass by the crowds of people trying to get into playland and after the Pour House closes- come here for a fresh squeezed Greyhound or a Gin Fizz. Its old timey done new. Grab a booth with your Hipster friends after band practice and enjoy this town you live in.
author: Sarah M.

description: Fun bar, cute private rooms in the back, casual and amazing bartenders making nice strong drinks!
author: Karen T.

description: A Polk Street bar that could easily be found in the Mission.  I feel like anybody would feel welcome drinking here.  Though I do think the space is oddly big?
author: Jeremy G.

description: Checked out this spot last night and had a blast.  Kevin the bartender was awesome.  Even though he was busy he kept the drinks coming and chatted us up.  Good tunes, cozy booths, loved the dark, candlelit vibe and creative cocktails.
author: Stevie b.

description:
This is a blink-and-you-miss-it kind of place, tucked in between a busy block of Polk Street. I can't tell you the number of times I've passed it without realizing that there is actually a bar there!

Went there for the first time yesterday, and it was great. They have $1 off draughts during happy hour and a pretty decent selection over all. Even though it got a little crowded as the evening progressed, I never had trouble hearing the people in my group (we were sitting at a booth).

It really sucks, though, that they don't accept credit cards. If they did, I would have probably given them 5*.
author: sar h.

description: Big fan of these folks and really appreciate the thought that went behind every detail of this bar. Most of the items are up and recycled materials that were carefully hand picked. It is all love, good service an awesome cocktails here. And this time, there is even wine on tap! Yes, wine!
author: Lisa Kim J.

description: I loved KoKo's and I'm happy to see them move, expand, redux and impress.  The space is huge and looks great. Plenty of seating and plenty of room.  Polk St. is officially bar hopper's heaven.  The block they're on now has everything you could possibly want.
author: Corey V.

description: Love love love...this place. The booths are awesome! the owners are totally rad! I am not going to write a "three page" review.
author: Jill F.

description: When I first saw it I thought that the place was falling apart lol The idea of the bar its to look like its old and bizarre, loved it! Cocktails a little expensive ($9*)
author: Beatriz L.

description:
what a great bar! a wonderful establishment with a very good cocktail and beer program and a hard to beat atmosphere! the details are amazing! and very nice and crafty bartenders!
some reviewers got it totally wrong and the yelp categorizing didn't help much either. this is NOT a dive (in a sf sense) but an authentically vintage looking bar circa 1912. 
the owners are definitely not hipsters, way too old. sf bar veterans since last century they looked like that 25 years ago already...
author: bmwcafe c.

description: Surprising find on Halloween night. Ordered a couple whiskey sours. Fresh fruit, stiff pours, great drink. I'm sure I'll come back again.
author: Daniel R.

description: Predictably, this place is darkly lit only by the now ubiquitous incandescent "Edison bulbs".  It's not much more than a narrow room with a good sized bar in it.  The drinks were okay, but I must say that it seemed like a bit of a boring place.  Symptomatic of what has happened with the 'gentrification' of the Polk corridor, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.  It gets three stars for at least serving a decent if not inexpensive cocktail.
author: Dave N.

description: Great staff, beer, cocktails, excellent high-ceilinged architecture... perfectly (dimmly) lit at night... all around an excellent place to drink.
author: aaron h.

description: I loved Koko's and now this..what a treat. Hopefully it will not be drenched with the Marina spill over.
author: Jack F.

description: One of the worst experiences in a bar in SF... All due to the staff, really in another world, might have been too busy thinking about their own bday day, but really rude! Will not go back or recommend...
author: Sof G.

description: this place totally has "new bar smell" so awesome! i love it. been here a couple of times and its a nice place. def like it. its cash only :( but my bank is across the street so it actually isnt too bad. the music here was actually pretty good. put me in a good mood. def a great place to start off a night!
author: Ashley H.

description: I kept walking by this place, and saw faint glimmers of action inside. I finally went in, and it's a nice spot. The front of the place seems a little empty, but the booths and counter are nice. Nice strong drinks, but this is cash only, so I gotta ding it.
author: B Y.

description: Wonderful ambiance, really great cocktails. Expensive, but a winner.
author: Nick S.

description: A place where Steve McQueen would be after a day of filming Bullitt. Has the look of seediness of that time in the light of candlelight and dimness. Just because of the length of the bar it could have been a soda counter without the soda.  The bartenders knows their craft and the mixologists within will be happy with what they have on their menu.  Will come back.
author: Uei L.
